intro: Onosma pulla, commonly known as the Persian wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Onosma pulla is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is adapted to well-drained soils and full sun.
